It is characterized by its hairy, square stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. Pocilla cymbalaria is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
